A.text: That hurt him, but then there's so much of him to hurt. Your weapon also broke in half.

B.text: He strikes faster than you expected. Where is your weapon? Take 2 rounds to recover it.

C.text: You strike him so hard that you lose the rest of your round from the vibratory feedback.

D.text: You strike him so enthusiastically that you must roll for a fumbled weapon.

E.text: That blow to his chest sends a numbing vibration through you. You stumble back.

A.text: That one popped some ornament on your weapon off it. He may have noticed you.

B.text: Your weapon hits at an awkward angle. Roll for weapon breakage and hope for the best.

C.text: You may have broken your weapon over his shoulder. Use the edge. Make a breakage check.

D.text:
You hurt his arm, but even better
you have the initiative next round.
Do something creative!

E.text:
Be more careful how you strike
him. Check for weapon breakage.
Use the edge.

A.text: Unable to withstand the stare of this awesome creature you make only a half-hearted attack.

B.text: He deflected your attack but he's in an awkward position. Initiative is yours next round.

C.text:
Clever strike to his leg captures his
attention and you gain the
initiative for next round.

D.text:
That whack to his back does little
damage. You know it will take
more than that to fell him.

E.text:
Your blow to his back gets his
attention and distracts him. You
have the initiative next round.

A.text: Now you know His hide deflects all but the strongest of blows. This won't be easy.

B.text: Your weapon may be magical after all. Your glancing blow left sparks in the air.

C.text: Your blow slides across his hide and actually leaves Adamantium smeared along its path.

D.text:
Your blow doesn’t even slow this
big, bad boy down. You hurt him
but he’s indifferent to pain.

E.text:
This time you use the edge. Sparks
are flying off his hide. You should
have an audience.

A.text: Solid strike to his flank but it doesn't do much good. Perhaps you need a higger weapon.

B.text: Finally, the big boy is unbalanced and you have the initiative next round. About time, too.

C.text: You bruise his calf muscle, but you realize it will take a critical attack to kill him.

D.text:
Now he’s angry. You hit him in the
chest with some effect but he only
screams at you.

E.text:
Blow to his chest makes a
satisfying thud, but it will take
more to bring this bad boy down.

A.text:
You strike him to ward off his
wild, swinging attack, but you do
him little real damage.

B.text:
You strike his “leg.” He stands
there staring. He can’t believe you
did that to him.

C.text:
Your blow to his “horn” actually
vibrates audibly. You felt it
through your weapon.

D.text:
Going low under his assault you
strike his abdomen. Too bad he’s
such a big boy.

E.text:
That was a glancing blow but
there’s hair, horn, scales, and
bodily fluids in the air.

A.text: You're starting to chip away at him. Are there a few scales or some fur in the air?

B.text: Nice strike placement to his neck, but his hide is too resistant. Harder next time?

C.text: "Hitting him in the nose" doesn't work on this one. He is angry with you now

D.text: Incautiously he leans his big snout down toward you. He rages loudly after you whack it.

E.text: Seizing a lucky break you pierce his side. You're both surprised.

A.text:
If only you had used the edge! The
flat of your weapon hits his neck
but can’t cut.

B.text:
As he lunges, you go low and
strike with the combined force to
his underside. He felt that.

C.text:
You tear open the skin on his
“shin” and penetrate the bone
itself. You have initiative.

D.text: This is the way to do it. Your strike to his shoulder has left him stunned and bleeding.

E.text: Somehow your weapon penetrates his chest and his heart. Instant death. Blood is all over you.

A.text: You're beginning to get the rhythm. Striking at his leg, you slip away from his counterattack.

B.text:
You have bruised his thigh but
your weapon has cracked and
bent. It will break next time

C.text:
The big guy gains some respect for
you after your whack to his thigh.
You have the initiative.

D.text: That blow to his thigh has staggered him. He's on his "feet" but you have initiative next rd.

E.text: That broke some bones in his chest. His guard is down and there is an opportunity for you.

A.text:
He has a really hard head. You
know because your weapon just
bounced off it.

B.text:
His hide is so tough that he uses
his forearm to parry. Well, you did
do some damage to it.

C.text:
His arm was a good target, but
you didn’t follow through. Put
your weight into it next time.

D.text: The bruise on his exposed leg will slow him down, so you have the initiative.

E.text: Glancing blow across his shoulder and chest does real damage regardless. He knows it.

A.text:
Well, your strike to his “arm” does
bruise it, but you must roll for
weapon breakage.

B.text:
Nice try at striking his arm joint.
He’s bruised. Maybe that was too
precise a target?

C.text:
You miss his vital parts but hear
his ribs crack loudly. Now this is
the way you like it.

D.text: You were all over him like a cheap tunic. His neck hurts and there is indeed some blood.

E.text: Did your weapon just display a mind of its own with that brilliant strike to his thigh?

A.text:
You strike with admirable force,
but you might try hitting a vital
spot in the future.

B.text:
Again his thick hide protects him.
He’s damaged, but you may need a
critical.

C.text:
He’ll be nursing his bruised neck
for the next 2 rounds. Too bad it’s
still on his shoulder.

D.text:
Decisively you strike his exposed
mouth. If he has a breath weapon
he may not use it.

E.text:
Your weapon is in his neck, but his
doom is his eyes. He falls and dies
in 3 rounds.

A.text:
Classic. You sever veins and an
artery in his leg. Yes, he falls and
dies in 12 rounds.

B.text:
Finally living up to your
reputation, you break his neck,
spine, etc. He falls and dies in 1 rd

C.text:
Enough already. You just destroy
his lower skull. After 1 round of
stun he realizes it too.

D.text:
Surprise! You cleave through his
skull killing him in 6 rds. Your
weapon falls with him.
All allies 1(+10)

E.text:
Your weapon plunges through his
chest. Take 12 rounds to extricate
it from his fallen form.

A.text:
Your strike deftly pierces through
his ribs. This one is going to be a
real bleeder.

B.text:
A flash of intuition reveals his
weak spot to you. You strike and
destroy it. He’s dead.

C.text:
Finally, one of your blows to his
neck strikes true. He falls and dies
in 1 round. Sweet!

D.text:
Your blow ruptures his heart in an
instant kill. Try to crawl out from
under as he falls on you.

E.text:
Why did he let you drive your
weapon through his eye like that?
He dies in 3 rounds.

A.text:
You’d have opened up his guts if
he was human. As it is your blow
glances off.

B.text:
He shields his bleeding ribs and
backs away cautiously. He doesn’t
like this much.

C.text:
Using “martial art” more than
sheer force you sweep away his
defenses and strike.

D.text:
He reels away from your strike to
his arm. He wishes he was
somewhere you weren’t.

E.text:
His leg bleeds mightily as he
writhes on the ground in pain and
dies in 6 rounds.

A.text:
His “arm” now features deep
wounds and severed muscles. Yes,
that is a lot of blood.

B.text:
That subtle tap dance on his head
stuns him long enough for you to
strike him for real.

C.text:
Very agile. Striking his calf you
also trip him with the attack. He’s
occupied for awhile.

D.text: He blocks your vicious blow with his forehead and then falls. He's in a coma if his head falls on a rock.

E.text:
With his chest and throat both
crushed, he falls and suffocates in
12 rounds.

A.text:
Seizing the opportunity you strike
his neck but without fatal effect.

B.text:
Your chest strike puts him down
and you even take an ‘A’
Unbalancing Critical. Scramble!

C.text:
Ripping open his side below the
ribs, you make him hate you. His
blood is all over both of you.

D.text:
Before this you had never seen a
pulped abdomen. Now you have
seen one.

E.text:
Tiring of all the back and forth
you strike him in the eye and kill
him with a single blow.

A.text:
His back goes snap, crackle and
pop as your blow lands. He has to
have internal damage.

B.text: His abdomen had a lot of blood in it. It's all over him and you. There's more in there.

C.text: You rip his leg open all the way down. You can hear your weapon congratulating you.

D.text: Slipping past his guard you tear his head apart through the ear. Brain damage kills in 3 rds.

E.text: Stepping past his guard you gut him. He dies in 4 rds, but he falls all over you. Very messy.

A.text:
He leads with his “face” exposing
his eyes to your reach. Coldly, you
blind him with a strike.

B.text: You penetrate his eye and brain as he leans over. In 1 round he will realize that he's dead.

C.text:
With his own bones driven
through both his lungs, he dies
after 18 rounds of coma.

D.text: His spirit is broken and so is his spine. He dies in 2 rounds. You look like an epic hero.

E.text: That sound must have been his ribcage breaking. He dies after bleeding all over you.
